intro: Padbruggea filipes, commonly known as the slender milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and typically have five petals. It is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils.
